definitions.definition: to hit somebody/something with the flat part of your hand

examples.text: She slapped him hard across the face.
‘Congratulations!’ he said, slapping me on the back.
I felt like I had been slapped in the face.
She slapped the boy on the leg.
I'll slap you if you do that again.

definitions.definition: to put something on a surface in a quick, careless and often noisy way, especially because you are angry

examples.text: He slapped the newspaper down on the desk.
She slapped a $10 bill into my hand.

definitions.definition: to hit against something with the noise of somebody being slapped

examples.text: The water slapped against the side of the boat.
I could hear bare feet slapping down the corridor.

wordOrigin: late Middle English (as a verb): probably imitative. The noun dates from the mid 17th cent.
